title: Find LCD
text: The least common denominator of $$\frac{2p+4}{8}$$ and $$\frac{p+18}{6}$$ is $$24$$.

title: Multiply LCD Both Sides
text: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get $$3\left(2p+4\right)=4\left(p+18\right)$$.

title: Isolate $$p$$ on One side
text: We can further simplify $$3\left(2p+4\right)=4\left(p+18\right)$$ to $$6p+12=4p+72$$. By subtracting $$12$$, we get $$6p=4p+60$$. We can subtract $$4p$$ both sides and get $$2p=60$$. Lastly, we can divide both sides by $$2$$ and get $$p=30$$ as the final answer.
